intro: Thrincia beltranii, commonly known as the Beltran's thrincia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow to orange. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
